newsitem.title: USA: Auto sales in U.S. up 0.4 pct May 11-20 -- CNW.
newsitem.headline: Auto sales in U.S. up 0.4 pct May 11-20 -- CNW.

text.p: Auto sales in the United States rose 0.4 percent in the 10 days of May 11-20 compared with the same period a year ago, according to a report by CNW Marketing/Research.
During the survey period, sales of domestic autos decreased 0.1 percent, while U.S. sales of imports rose 2.9 percent.
Specifically, domestic car sales fell 2.0 percent, to 219,391 from 223,883, CNW said. Domestic truck sales rose 2.0 percent, to 206,391 from 202,273, it said.
Import car sales advanced 2.6 percent to 64,524, and import truck sales rose 5.3 percent to 10,538, the report said.
Year-to-date, about vehicle sales in the United States reached 5.76 million, off 0.3 percent from the same period of 1996, according to CNW.
